page.title: 13HEALTH - HARMSTON & COLEBY
page.content: Both villages are controlled by the Northern Area Health Authority from Lincoln County Hospital (medical and surgical) and St John's Hospital, Bracebridge Heath (psychiatric). Six doctors are available, including MO RAF Waddington. Waddington & Navenby have 1-2 weekday surgeries, visits emergency only. Both a district and a bath nurse visit at doctor's direction. Specialist contact and hospital treatment, with possible free transport, available through GPs. There are surgery-based clinics for expectant mothers. Approved medicines are prescribed and dispensed at surgeries by GPs and are free to OAPs, handicapped and children. A social worker, Lincoln-based, attends the blind, providing canes, free radios, and talking books, etc. Hearing aids, zimmers and crutches are free on loan.
